title: More than 200 people evacuated from hostel after massive fire breaks out
text:
Dozens of people were evacuated from a backpacking accommodation in Kensal Green in London (Picture: London Fire Brigade)

A massive fire at a hostel in north-west London led to more than 200 people being evacuated from the building last night.

Around 60 firefighters in eight engines rushed to tackle the fire at Kensal Green Backpackers in Harrow Road.

Part of the ground floor was damaged in the blaze which started at around 11.38pm.

It is not known what caused the fire at this stage.

More than 200 people were evacuated from the five-floor building before the brigade arrived.

Firefighters discuss how to tackle the blaze at Kensal Green Backpackers (Picture: London Fire Brigade)

One witness on Twitter posted: ‘Hostel opposite Kensal Green tube is on fire.

‘Hope everyone got out ok.’

A statement from London Fire Brigade said: ‘The brigade was called at 2338 and the fire was under control at 0119.

‘Fire crews from North Kensington, Wilesden, Park Royal, Paddington and West Hampstead attended the scene.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘The cause of the fire will be investigated.’

Got a story for Metro.co.uk? Get in touch with our news team by emailing us at webnews@metro.co.uk. For more stories like this, check our news page.
description: Around 60 firefighters were called to tackle the blaze at backpackers accommodation in north-west London.
